meanings.definition: A structure used in mining to support the hoisting mechanism
meanings.sent1: The headframe stood tall above the mine, helping lift heavy loads.
meanings.sent2: Miners gathered around the headframe to begin their descent into the shaft.
meanings.sent3: The headframe decided it was tired of lifting things and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: The headframe loomed over the mine like a giant metal guardian.
meanings.sent5: The clanking of the headframe echoed through the underground tunnels.

meanings.definition: The upper part of a mine shaft
meanings.sent1: At the top of the mine shaft, the headframe marked the entrance to the depths below.
meanings.sent2: The headframe cast a shadow over the miners as they emerged from the shaft.
meanings.sent3: The headframe felt like the king of the mine, overseeing all that happened below.
meanings.sent4: The headframe perched atop the shaft like a watchful sentinel.
meanings.sent5: The headframe framed the sky above, a reminder of the world beyond the depths.

meanings.definition: A frame at the top of a mine shaft used to support the hoisting mechanism
meanings.sent1: Miners relied on the headframe to safely bring them up from the depths of the mine.
meanings.sent2: The headframe creaked as it lifted the ore to the surface.
meanings.sent3: The headframe joked with the miners, saying, 'I've got your back!'
meanings.sent4: The headframe was the unsung hero of the mine, silently aiding in the work below.
meanings.sent5: The headframe's metal beams intertwined like a protective embrace over the mine shaft.
